org.eclipse.microprofile.reactive.streams

Class ProcessorBuilder<T,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.microprofile.reactive.streams.ProcessorBuilder<T,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the elements that the processor consumes.
    R - The type of the elements that the processor emits.

    public final class ProcessorBuilder<T,R>
extends Object
    A builder for a Processor.
    See Also:
    ReactiveStreams

    • Method Detail

      • map

        public <S> ProcessorBuilder<T,S> map(Function<? super R,? extends S> mapper)
        Map the elements emitted by this processor using the mapper function.
        Type Parameters:
        S - The type of elements that the mapper function emits.
        Parameters:
        mapper - The function to use to map the elements.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder that consumes elements of type T and emits the mapped elements.

      • peek

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,R> peek(Consumer<? super R> consumer)
        Returns a stream containing all the elements from this stream, additionally performing the provided action on each element.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The function called for every element.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder that consumes elements of type T and emits the same elements. In between, the given function is called for each element.

      • filter

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,R> filter(Predicate<? super R> predicate)
        Filter elements emitted by this processor using the given Predicate.

        Any elements that return true when passed to the Predicate will be emitted, all other elements will be dropped.

        Parameters:
        predicate - The predicate to apply to each element.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder.

      • distinct

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,T> distinct()
        Creates a stream consisting of the distinct elements (according to Object.equals(Object)) of this stream.
        Returns:
        A new publisher builder emitting the distinct elements from this stream.

      • flatMap

        public <S> ProcessorBuilder<T,S> flatMap(Function<? super R,PublisherBuilder<? extends S>> mapper)
        Map the elements to publishers, and flatten so that the elements emitted by publishers produced by the mapper function are emitted from this stream.

        This method operates on one publisher at a time. The result is a concatenation of elements emitted from all the publishers produced by the mapper function.

        Unlike flatMapPublisher(Function), the mapper function returns a PublisherBuilder and not a Publisher.

        Type Parameters:
        S - The type of the elements emitted from the new processor.
        Parameters:
        mapper - The mapper function.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder.

      • flatMapPublisher

        public <S> ProcessorBuilder<T,S> flatMapPublisher(Function<? super R,org.reactivestreams.Publisher<? extends S>> mapper)
        Map the elements to publishers, and flatten so that the elements emitted by publishers produced by the mapper function are emitted from this stream.

        This method operates on one publisher at a time. The result is a concatenation of elements emitted from all the publishers produced by the mapper function.

        Unlike flatMap(Function), the mapper function returns a Publisher and not a PublisherBuilder.

        Type Parameters:
        S - The type of the elements emitted from the new processor.
        Parameters:
        mapper - The mapper function.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder.

      • flatMapCompletionStage

        public <S> ProcessorBuilder<T,S> flatMapCompletionStage(Function<? super R,? extends CompletionStage<? extends S>> mapper)
        Map the elements to CompletionStage, and flatten so that the elements the values redeemed by each CompletionStage are emitted from this processor.

        This method only works with one element at a time. When an element is received, the mapper function is executed, and the next element is not consumed or passed to the mapper function until the previous CompletionStage is redeemed. Hence this method also guarantees that ordering of the stream is maintained.

        Type Parameters:
        S - The type of the elements emitted from the new processor.
        Parameters:
        mapper - The mapper function.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder.

      • flatMapIterable

        public <S> ProcessorBuilder<T,S> flatMapIterable(Function<? super R,? extends Iterable<? extends S>> mapper)
        Map the elements to Iterable's, and flatten so that the elements contained in each iterable are emitted by this stream.

        This method operates on one iterable at a time. The result is a concatenation of elements contain in all the iterables returned by the mapper function.

        Type Parameters:
        S - The type of the elements emitted from the new processor.
        Parameters:
        mapper - The mapper function.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder.

      • limit

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,R> limit(long maxSize)
        Truncate this stream, ensuring the stream is no longer than maxSize elements in length.

        If maxSize is reached, the stream will be completed, and upstream will be cancelled. Completion of the stream will occur immediately when the element that satisfies the maxSize is received.

        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum size of the returned stream.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If maxSize is less than zero.

      • skip

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,R> skip(long n)
        Discard the first n of this stream. If this stream contains fewer than n elements, this stream will effectively be an empty stream.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of elements to discard.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If n is less than zero.

      • takeWhile

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,R> takeWhile(Predicate<? super R> predicate)
        Take the longest prefix of elements from this stream that satisfy the given predicate.

        When the predicate returns false, the stream will be completed, and upstream will be cancelled.

        Parameters:
        predicate - The predicate.
        Returns:
        A new publisher builder.

      • dropWhile

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,R> dropWhile(Predicate<? super R> predicate)
        Drop the longest prefix of elements from this stream that satisfy the given predicate.

        As long as the predicate returns true, no elements will be emitted from this stream. Once the first element is encountered for which the predicate returns false, all subsequent elements will be emitted, and the predicate will no longer be invoked.

        Parameters:
        predicate - The predicate.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder.

      • forEach

        public SubscriberBuilder<T,Void> forEach(Consumer<? super R> action)
        Performs an action for each element on this stream.

        The returned CompletionStage from the CompletionSubscriber will be redeemed when the stream completes, either successfully if the stream completes normally, or with an error if the stream completes with an error or if the action throws an exception.

        Parameters:
        action - The action.
        Returns:
        A new subscriber builder.

      • ignore

        public SubscriberBuilder<T,Void> ignore()
        Ignores each element of this stream.

        The returned CompletionStage from the CompletionSubscriber will be redeemed when the stream completes, either successfully if the stream completes normally, or with an error if the stream completes with an error or if the action throws an exception.

        Returns:
        A new subscriber builder.

      • cancel

        public SubscriberBuilder<T,Void> cancel()
        Cancels the stream as soon as it starts.

        The returned CompletionStage from the CompletionSubscriber will be immediately redeemed as soon as the stream starts.

        Returns:
        A new subscriber builder.

      • reduce

        public SubscriberBuilder<T,R> reduce(R identity,
                                     BinaryOperator<R> accumulator)
        Perform a reduction on the elements of this stream, using the provided identity value and the accumulation function.

        The result of the reduction is returned in the CompletionSubscriber.

        Parameters:
        identity - The identity value.
        accumulator - The accumulator function.
        Returns:
        A new subscriber builder.

      • reduce

        public SubscriberBuilder<T,Optional<R>> reduce(BinaryOperator<R> accumulator)
        Perform a reduction on the elements of this stream, using provided the accumulation function.

        The result of the reduction is returned in the CompletionSubscriber. If there are no elements in this stream, empty will be returned.

        Parameters:
        accumulator - The accumulator function.
        Returns:
        A new subscriber builder.

      • reduce

        public <S> SubscriberBuilder<T,S> reduce(S identity,
                                         BiFunction<S,? super R,S> accumulator,
                                         BinaryOperator<S> combiner)
        Perform a reduction on the elements of this stream, using the provided identity value, accumulation function and combiner function.

        The result of the reduction is returned in the CompletionSubscriber.

        Parameters:
        identity - The identity value.
        accumulator - The accumulator function.
        combiner - The combiner function.
        Returns:
        A new subscriber builder.

      • collect

        public <S,A> SubscriberBuilder<T,S> collect(Collector<? super R,A,S> collector)
        Collect the elements emitted by this processor builder using the given Collector.

        Since Reactive Streams are intrinsically sequential, only the accumulator of the collector will be used, the combiner will not be used.

        Type Parameters:
        S - The result of the collector.
        A - The accumulator type.
        Parameters:
        collector - The collector to collect the elements.
        Returns:
        A SubscriberBuilder that represents this processor builders inlet.

      • collect

        public <S> SubscriberBuilder<T,S> collect(Supplier<S> supplier,
                                          BiConsumer<S,? super R> accumulator)
        Collect the elements emitted by this processor builder using a Collector built from the given supplier and accumulator.

        Since Reactive Streams are intrinsically sequential, the combiner will not be used. This is why this method does not accept a combiner method.

        Type Parameters:
        S - The accumulator type.
        Parameters:
        supplier - a function that creates a new result container. It creates objects of type <S>.
        accumulator - an associative, non-interfering, stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        Returns:
        A SubscriberBuilder that represents this processor builders inlet.

      • toList

        public SubscriberBuilder<T,List<R>> toList()
        Collect the elements emitted by this processor builder into a List
        Returns:
        A SubscriberBuilder that represents this processor builders inlet.

      • findFirst

        public SubscriberBuilder<T,Optional<R>> findFirst()
        Find the first element emitted by the Processor, and return it in a CompletionStage.

        If the stream is completed before a single element is emitted, then Optional.empty() will be emitted.

        Returns:
        A SubscriberBuilder that represents this processor builders inlet.

      • to

        public SubscriberBuilder<T,Void> to(org.reactivestreams.Subscriber<R> subscriber)
        Connect the outlet of the Processor built by this builder to the given Subscriber.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - The subscriber to connect.
        Returns:
        A SubscriberBuilder that represents this processor builders inlet.

      • to

        public <S> SubscriberBuilder<T,S> to(SubscriberBuilder<R,S> subscriber)
        Connect the outlet of this processor builder to the given SubscriberBuilder graph.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - The subscriber builder to connect.
        Returns:
        A SubscriberBuilder that represents this processor builders inlet.

      • onError

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,R> onError(Consumer<Throwable> errorHandler)
        Returns a stream containing all the elements from this stream, additionally performing the provided action if this stream conveys an error. The given consumer is called with the failure.
        Parameters:
        errorHandler - The function called with the failure.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder that consumes elements of type T and emits the same elements. If the stream conveys a failure, the given error handler is called.

      • onTerminate

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,R> onTerminate(Runnable action)
        Returns a stream containing all the elements from this stream, additionally performing the provided action when this stream completes or failed. The given action does not know if the stream failed or completed. If you need to distinguish use onError(Consumer) and onComplete(Runnable). In addition, the action is called if the stream is cancelled downstream.
        Parameters:
        action - The function called when the stream completes or failed.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder that consumes elements of type T and emits the same elements. The given action is called when the stream completes or fails.

      • onComplete

        public ProcessorBuilder<T,R> onComplete(Runnable action)
        Returns a stream containing all the elements from this stream, additionally performing the provided action when this stream completes.
        Parameters:
        action - The function called when the stream completes.
        Returns:
        A new processor builder that consumes elements of type T and emits the same elements. The given action is called when the stream completes.

      • via

        public <S> ProcessorBuilder<T,S> via(ProcessorBuilder<R,S> processor)
        Connect the outlet of the Processor built by this builder to the given Processor.
        Parameters:
        processor - The processor to connect.
        Returns:
        A ProcessorBuilder that represents this processor builders inlet, and the passed in processors outlet.

      • via

        public <S> ProcessorBuilder<T,S> via(org.reactivestreams.Processor<R,S> processor)
        Connect the outlet of this processor builder to the given ProcessorBuilder graph.
        Parameters:
        processor - The processor builder to connect.
        Returns:
        A ProcessorBuilder that represents this processor builders inlet, and the passed in processor builders outlet.

        public org.reactivestreams.Processor<T,R> buildRs()
        Build this stream, using the first ReactiveStreamsEngine found by the ServiceLoader.
        Returns:
        A Processor that will run this stream.

      • buildRs

        public org.reactivestreams.Processor<T,R> buildRs(ReactiveStreamsEngine engine)
        Build this stream, using the supplied ReactiveStreamsEngine.
        Parameters:
        engine - The engine to run the stream with.
        Returns:
        A Processor that will run this stream.
